Reviews.Title: “Visiting SD from Michigan”
Reviews.Author: Kerry L
Reviews.Content: My two sons graduated from USMC boot camp on March 2, so my wife & daughter & I flew to San Diego early and stayed at the HoJo on Rosecrans from Sunday thru Friday. It was a wise choice; close to MCRD and not far from many nice restaurants and most SD attractions. The staff at HoJo in SD is exceptional. We arrived earlier than check-in time, so they allowed us to safely store our luggage while we visited Old Towne before returning later to officially check into our room. During the week the staff was eager to help and always courteous and friendly, no matter what issue or question we had. The free shuttle to/from MCRD was a huge bonus as well. On Friday after graduation we weren’t scheduled to fly out until late in the evening, so again we were allowed to store our luggage (this time for 5 people) in a secure area while we spent the day with the boys at the Midway Museum and other attractions. What a great convenience that was for us – thank you! This HoJo caters to Marine families, so if you're coming to SD for that please consider staying there as they will treat you like family! Thanks again for a wonderful stay. We hope to visit again so we can finish our sight-seeing. K&J in MI

Reviews.Title: “Attention Marine Families”
Reviews.Author: Katy H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we were in San Diego for our son's graduation from the Marines. We couldn't have asked for better people. There are free shuttles to and from the airport and the base. When everything was running way behind, the shuttle driver knew which gate to take us to that would get us in faster. Jessica at the front desk helped in so many way from getting us a wheel chair for my father in law to suggesting places to eat. I know how overwhelming it can be Marine Parents - these people take a lot of the stress off of you!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sheila t
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean; the staff is knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. We had three rooms, and they were all of superior quality. The guests were quiet. The location is ideal for moving around the city. We used the public transportation system and private transportation offered through the hotel. This is a great place to stay and feel that the people care about the quality of their guests' experience without being imposing. March 2012

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: KimJ_in_Oregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we were in San Diego for a few days. The hotel appears slightly old but was extremely well kept. The rooms were clean and the maids tidied it daily. The maids here were especially nice as they cleaned the entire room except the fort pillow my girls had built in one corner and left with a tiny sign, "Please leave our fort alone". The service here was exceptional. The nice man at the front desk (cannot recall his name) was well beyond pleasant - he was helpful, made recommendations and remembered my name for the remainder of the trip. The other staff were just as nice. The front desk even warned us about a local scam that was going on (flyers stuffed under the room doors). The pool was clean and the right temperature. The breakfast was very good with fresh fruit, cereals, oatmeal, pastries, a waffle bar and juice. There wasn't a lot of room to sit but we could usually find an open spot. We were very close to both the airport and Sea World. The San Diego zoo was, perhaps, a 20 minute drive away by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service and clean, comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Geeges
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here on our last night of vacation to be close to the airport. We were met with friendly, helpful staff and were impressed with the comfortable, clean room. The front desk even called and left us a message in case we needed anything. Great customer service! Lots of shopping close by and good restaurants. Easy directions were provided in our room to the airport and many other attractions. Would definitely stay here again! Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Decent and convient”
Reviews.Author: housefrau99
Reviews.Content: We booked this for our last night in town. The room was basic and clean.The breakfast was sparse, but it is across the street from a strip mall with Star Bucks, CVS, some fast food and Whole Foods. There is also a gas station on the corner so filling up the rental the next morning was easy. They also have an airport shuttle which we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price to stay overnight”
Reviews.Author: stylus1
Reviews.Content: good hotel for the price,very friendly front desk staf service and exellent mexican restaurant next door.convinient location,plaza and shops right infront of the hotel.One strange thing though!!!before you get your keys you have to sign the paper that you agree to pay $1.13 charge for use of the safe??? HONESTLY I HATE HIDDEN CHARGES CONSIDER IT AS NON FARE BUISINESS!ITS NOT ABOUT $1.13 most people just sign the paper without questions but if you do so next time they are going to charge you for hairdryer or pillows and blunkets. . . By the way i rejected to pay this chsrge and they easely remove it from my bill.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Juanita J
Reviews.Content: My stay was outstanding the room was great and the staff was awesome, Dobri was simply the best.Our Shuttle service was also great my overall stay was outstanding !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal for the money, but probably not again!”
Reviews.Author: ShreRnae
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire, and didn't know the hotel until we confirmed. We paid $155 for 2 nights. Price was good. Hotel was clean. There was no hot water the first morning. The second morning we got a later start and there was water. Obviously, the more people using the water, the less hot there is. We requested that a light bulb be replaced - it never happened. The walls are thin, but the room was clean. The bed was comfortable too.

Reviews.Title: “MCRD graduation”
Reviews.Author: Tina S
Reviews.Content: Awesome customer service. We had great shuttle service to and from MCRD and the airport and they were always willing to work with us to get a taxi for our adventures elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Tommy72A
Reviews.Content: The building it self is old and the furniture is showing it's age but it appears to be clean and maintained. Staff was friendly and they do offer a great shuttle service to old town, sea world and airport. If you are planning to hang around at the hotel, this isn't the place for you. This is not a destination resort hotel. If you are using this as a home base for your SD vacation, this clean comfortable quiet motel can be had at very reasonable rate. Lot's of places to eat near by and good location for all activities. I recommend this place for value oriented travelers. (not cheap travelers, there is a difference)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen022
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at hj great location close to sea world and zoo staff very friendly great Mexican resturant upstairs and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: universitymom4
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very friendly and helpful front desk staff. My room was clean and included a refrigerator and microwave. The TV had a full range of cable stations, including my favorite HGTV. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but decent accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: James T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and a party of 3 others attended a Graduation Ceremony October 20-21, 2011 at the nearby Marine Corps Training Base - MCRD and we all stayed here. The hotel is very conveniently located to the airport, Sea World, MCRD, the beach and many other San Diego points of interest. It's an older facility, but well maintained, and everything worked exactly as promised. The high point was the outstanding courtesy, friendliness and willingness of the desk staff to go the second mile for guests. On the downside, the fireworks from Sea World after 9 PM are a definite distraction, and the food was a disappointment. The breakfast waffles were undercooked and soggy. I had to throw mine out. Could be there were just so many people eating breakfast at the same time. The hotel was overpriced because so many family members stayed here and attended the Graduation Ceremony. The price was bumped from $79 to $109 a night. That's overpriced but other nearby hotels play the same game so there's not much you can do. The quality of food at the Mexican restaurant next door left a lot to be desired. We're from Phoenix and we know good Mexican and Tex-Mex food. The service was great and the restaurant was very clean but the food was so-so at best and the upstairs location leaves a lot to be desired. I would recommend the hotel based on it's merits but suggest you eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jogeocal
Reviews.Content: previous reviews are in line with our experience. Staff extremely helpful, cooperative. The shuttle to Seaworld leaves at 10:20AM and returns at 5:50PM, there are no other times. If 7 hours there is too long (was for us) suggest you drive, parking at Seaworld is $14 (ouch). Desk clerk recommended Anthony's for seafood, excellent choice. Is on the bay but parking is tough. Meters are 25cents for 12 minutes, so get a lot of quarters. The meters work on weekends until 6:00PM and it is free after that. The motel has thin walls and sound is a problem at times. We had a ground floor unit, it might have been quieter on the 2nd floor. Wouild stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and clean.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKat
Reviews.Content: The HoJo near the San Diego airport is clean, and easy to find. The room was neat, but dated. I don't think they updated their rooms since I stayed there as a child! (across the country, but same idea!) They have a fridge that was empty, so you can bring refreshments to your room. I didn't make it to the continental breakfast, which is complimentary, since they serve from 6am-9am. There was a strange smell at the front desk. I can't put my finger on it, but it smelled sour and off. There was plenty of parking in the lot, but it was not brightly lit. Overall, this place is ok to crash for one night, but I wouldn't recommend vacationing here. The price was also exaggerated.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay for our Marine's graduation.”
Reviews.Author: beth k
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. The staff which included Jessica, Dave and Randy were all terrific with service in every area. The room was homey and clean. When searching for places to stay in the future, they have made Howard Johnson the first hotel to look for in our search. Thank you for making our travel experience to San Diego, CA a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Interior: Nice. Exterior: oldie”
Reviews.Author: cokecasanova
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel located in a good location, near to freeway 5 and 8, so practically youÂ´re in the heart on san diego and can make good driving times to every interesting point: downtown, airport, la jolla, sea world, balboa park, fashion valley, plaza las americas outlet, etc. I went to a business meeting, and by bad luck I got a very high price for the room $189 per night, and this was because it was the Comic Con during those days, so the prices were very high for the few available rooms in all San Diego, I think the prices were three times higher during those days; try no to make business or pleaseure trips to San Diego during Comic Con weekends, you will have a hard time finding hotels and rental cars. This hotel was the first one that I stay from the Howard Johnson franchise. And the averall impression was higher than expected. From the outside it seems old, but well conserved... but inside the room it seems new, except for the old tube TV. The room was clean, the bathroom was nice, except than the towels needed to be more soft. They offered a breakfast included from 6 to 9 am, but I didnÂ´t took it, but the breakfast area seems no be comfortable. They free offer WiFi internet, but at my room I catched a very low signal and wasnÂ´t able to connect, my room was the 238, the farest room on the hotel, maybe that was the reason but they need to improve thei network. Averall I recommend this hotel because the location is one of the best in San Diego and the rooms are very nice. Also I want to congratulate the housekeeping staff from my room alley, she always had a smiling face.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well kept”
Reviews.Author: penjimop
Reviews.Content: The service desk was great-A Hi to Dave from Buffalo. This hotel was very clean, and big. It was very nice for the price. The pool was small, but you should be at the beach anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay....but first and last stay with Howard Johnson”
Reviews.Author: missholly24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for MCRD graduation. Room was nice and clean, but the bed was a rock-definately extra firm mattress. The MCRD shuttle was a mess. We were told to be at shuttle stop at 5p.m. on family day(one hour earlier than our recruit had to be back) shuttle didnt show up until after 6. (we saw many other hotel shuttles coming and going. Had to take a taxi from airport because shuttle stopped after 8pm. Little things like this that make you decide not to come back. They were definately doing what they had to get by. Nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Will defiantly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseNR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and found the room to be clean and quite large with more than enough room for our family of 4. The staff were friendly and helpful and the free wi-fi was defiantly a bonus. There were so many places around to eat at and most were walking distance from the hotel. Overall we were very pleased with choosing this hotel and will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: kkett01
Reviews.Content: After a bad week at several hotels on this vacation i finally had a great two days at Howard Johnson Inn. The room was cleaned and serviced well. The management staff had outstanding customer service. The bed was comfortable. The restaraunt above the office was great mexican food. The pool was fun but not heated.. water was too cold for the kid to swim. The manager gave me easy directions to sea world and zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the area-clean!”
Reviews.Author: MnMsMemo
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. It was clean... which is a huge plus in an economy hotel. This place passed the hair test... none found anywhere (other than my own!). I found the bathroom very large and attactive...new tile and granite-like counters. The cons? Well, the breakfast is lacking. Waffles,cold cereal, boiled eggs and toast... and that's about it. The blankets were clean but appeared "worn"...time to replace. And, yes, they charged for the safe which I did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: bmgilber
Reviews.Content: The hotel has recently been remodeled. The room was large (we stayed in a room with a king size bed), there was a love seat with a coffee table and a desk. The hotel says it only offers a microwave, but there was also a fridge in our room, which was a welcome surprise! The only issue we had was with the bathroom light. The staff was very nice and explained that they went green with motion lights in the bathroom- but will be switching back to regular switches since people have been complaining of the light going off while in the shower!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSAustralia
Reviews.Content: Howard Johnson hotels are more budget orientated however this hotel didn't give the impression that it was "cheap" It's not luxurious but the room we had was large (2 queen size beds) clean and comfortable. It seemed as though it had recently been refurbished. It had a small but functional bathroom, a separate area for making a hot drink and a wardrobe adjacent which also had a safe (coin operated). A corner table and chairs for using a laptop or reading was also very useful. Free Wifi and parking at the door of your unit was a bonus, with the complimentary breakfast being the best we had. You had a choice of cereals, toast, pastries, waffles (make yourself) eggs, juice and hot drinks. The staff were fantastic and helpful. Within walking distance to a convenience store/pharmacy, bottle shop and other stores. Very close to an Olive Garden restaurant and Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay Overall - $1 Safe Fee is annoying”
Reviews.Author: falconflyer
Reviews.Content: A clean spacious room with the usual conveniences (coffee maker, microwave, fridge, etc.). Good value, good location. Friendly, helpful staff at the front desk. Lots of restaurant options within walking distance, although a few seedy characters in the neighborhood. Breakfast was basic. The waffles are a hit with the guests, although it would be nice if they had real syrup, jam or butter instead of the chemical-laden imitations. An annoyance was a $1/night fee that is tacked on to your bill (plus taxes) for the safe in the room, whether you want it or not. Seems like a cheap ploy to gain some extra profits at the expense of good will. Not enough money to complain to the front desk about, but an annoyance none the less. Overall a good stay, and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: skjlrand
Reviews.Content: Needed a safe, clean, reasonably priced hotel near the airport for one night before meeting a group and heading to the Baja on a mission trip. This hotel did the trick. The front desk clerk, Daniela, was extremely pleasant when we checked in. Complimentary nacho appetizer at the connected restaurant which was the perfect snack at the end of a long day of traveling. I'm not a big fan of hotels with outside entrances to the rooms, but for one night I got over it. The room was spacious, the bed was very comfortable and it was reasonably clean. The room had a slight musty smell to it and some of the furniture had stains on the material, but it was OK. The bathroom was clean. I probably wouldn't bring my family here for a week long vacation, but for some this might be the perfect place based on price/location.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT place to stay for Marine families”
Reviews.Author: Skipper711
Reviews.Content: My husband, his dad and two sisters rented two adjoining rooms for his nephew's Marine graduation. All in all, the rooms were nice, clean and comfortable, and included 2 queen beds, coffeemaker, microwave and small frig. The continental breakfast was average, and included toast, pasteries, waffles, cereal, juice and coffee. The best part about this hotel was that the transportation was included with the room price. There is sometimes a wait, but it was worth it not to rent a car. This was actually one of the reasons this hotel was chosen. The fact that they provide free transportation for the Marine families is such a huge benefit, and that is why we would recommend this facility to anyone coming to the area. We really appreciated the courteousness from the Howard Johnson from the time of booking until departure. The staff were all wonderful. The Mexican restaurant attached to to the hotel had exceptional food. The hotel pool was nice but small. Old Towne in San Diego was a great highlight to the trip and we really enjoyed it. Definitely recommend a trip there to anyone who visits. If you're looking for the Ritz, this isn't it, but if you want a safe, clean, practical hotel which includes transportation, this place makes it easy for traveling families. We thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient San Diego hotel for Marine graduation!”
Reviews.Author: grace1959
Reviews.Content: I had sought out a budget-friendly hotel in San Diego that did not cost an arm and a leg. I had heard that this budget hotel is very Marine-friendly, and they are! They offer a free shuttle to the Marine Corps Recruit Depot as well as a free airport shuttle. A basic continental breakfast is included. The rooms are very clean and the management is wonderful. The desk clerk actually sought out my son (Marine graduate) in the lobby and congratulated him and thanked him for serving our country! This is not a luxury hotel by any means, it is a fairly basic motel, but I found it very convenient. People have commented that the neighborhood is not good....it is one of those areas that few would confuse with Beverly Hills, but it seemed safe enough.

Reviews.Title: “The service we recieved afterwards was horrible and rude.”
Reviews.Author: staceyxoxos
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Howard Johnsons for MCRD graduation. We stayed here 2 years ago so knew the area and what we were getting for our money. The problem came when one of the hotel staff in the cleaning dept. broke our computer. We had left the computer on the bed and went to graduation. I know it was on the bed because my daughter who goes to college was finishing a paper and saved her info and closed the computer and said she would finish it when we got back. However, when we got back to the room it was in the floor. With all the excitement of being with my newly graduated Marine I didn't look at the computer for the rest of that day. The next morning my son said, "Mom whats wrong with the computer and I said nothing why? he said it wouldn't turn on. I replied the battery is just dead, we will charge it at the airport as we were checking out that day. When we arrived at the airport I noticed it had been dropped and broken. I called the manager and she informed me she was going out of town on a business trip at that moment but would get in touch with her housekeeping staff and call me back later in the week. That week came and went with no phone call from her. I called back Monday only to be told she was busy but I could leave a message and she would call me back. I left my message with no return yet again. I have called twice since then and have yet to speak to anyone concerning my computer. I can't believe a hotel manager would be so rude and unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hope016
Reviews.Content: Everything was very good, room, breakfast, services. We'll say 100% if the wireless internet service was stable.

Reviews.Title: “Much More than Expected”
Reviews.Author: jamuckley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! It was centrally located (close to the Airport, SeaWorld, Old Town, and Downtown) and it really impressed me. It was very clean, the rooms were big, the rooms had better than average amenities (included a refrigerator). A pool, free wifi, continental breakfast, and was very reasonably priced! I definitely recommend this place. Next time I am in San Diego I will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: NGM1976
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean with nice free breakfast included. Fridge, microwave and safe in room. 10-15 minute walk to Old Town bus/train station where you can get anywhere. Ask for a room upstairs as less foot traffic noise. Lage carpark with two entrances/exits. Mexican restaurant on site was tasty. PC in reception to use with ability to print tickets off etc was nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Provide great directions to attractions”
Reviews.Author: jeolmstead
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, small pool, pool towels very rough and not well stocked. Provide you with well written directions to attractions at time of registration. In room safe would not work, charged for no matter what. Small drawers for unpacking if staying for extended stay. Internet service would nnot work any either room.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Clean - Very basic Continental Breakfast - Thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: Rforce
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights. Pricing is good for the location, and there are a number of restaurant options nearby. Breakfast was VERY basic (even for a Continental), with hard-boiled eggs only being offered every OTHER day. They do have the waffles every day though, so I'll cut them a little slack! As a few other posts have noted, the walls are pretty thin, so you may want to remember to bring your earplugs. This hotel is a good option for people flying in, with the intent of Seaworld being their main excursion. If you have any other destinations in mind, or you have driven to San Diego in a vehicle, I would recommend staying in a different hotel, and saving yourself a few bucks. I saw one of the other Howard Johnsons in San Diego advertised for significantly less than this one (about an 8 min drive away)! WiFi at this location could use some upgrading and consistency also.....very intermittent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Angie-Bruce
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on a tour of America. The hotel was in a great location for driving to different parts of San Diego. When we arrived I really fancied a cup of tea but didn't have any fresh milk (I really don't like the powdered stuff). We ask the gentleman at reception and he went to the breakfast room to get some milk for me - thank you, it was much appreciated! The food in the attached restaurant was good - huge portions. The rooms are standard motel rooms and there is a handy guest laundry. It was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: bdtravelers
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The staff was very accomodating. The neighborhood somewhat strange--safe going one way and very suspect the other. We were there for a week and just so I could introduce my husband to the sights. We found it very hard to get around the city from the hotel but all in all, I would recommend it. The pool and pool area were dismal. The restaurant was just a place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but EXTREMELY thin walls”
Reviews.Author: RaniShea
Reviews.Content: My family (two adults and a toddler) stayed at this hotel for four nights in May 2010. Pro's: 1) Very friendly front desk staff; 2) spacious room that appeared to have been recently remodeled; 3) location very convenient to Sea World and the San Diego Zoo. Cons: 1) Thinnest walls I have ever experienced! We heard the man next door reading a bedtime story to his kids in a perfectly normal voice. 2) The continental breakfast was disappointing--a waffle maker, some cereal, a few pastries, and coffee/juice. I waited in line about 20 minutes for my turn at the waffle maker. 3) Although the neighborhood seemed overall clean and safe, be aware that there are some "adult" establishments just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value motel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Poundhappy
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay in this motel. The staff were friendly and efficient, check in was easy and lots of literature on things to do. We didn't use the airport or Seaworld free shuttle service, but it was great to have this available. The rooms were clean and well furnished. Beds were really comfy (I've come back deciding I need to buy myself a new mattress!). Good to have the extra room facilities (fridge, microwave etc), although I didn't need to use them. The breakfast was great - plentiful, even when nearly at the end of time and staff were replenishing low stocks of food / drinks. The location was excellent for seeing everything in San Diego. Parking was plentiful, shops and eating places were nearby too. I was hardly aware of airport noise or those of other people staying there and slept really well every night. I would definately recommend this motel and would stay there again. Super value for a super motel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: OsageBeach_MOMark
Reviews.Content: The location was great but the service (especially AM & PM Desk ). Property was extremely clean and well maintained and rooms were very nice also. So much within walking distance or short cab ride and on property Mexican Restaurant was very good!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: garrgirl
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this property! Newly remodeled rooms, beautiful decor, comfortable bed, good sized room, great AAA price, simple but good breakfast, shuttle and friendly staff. Slightly noisy from airport. I'd absolutely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty sweet place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: flip998
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HOJO in San Diego for a weekend with my wife and two young children and could not be happier. It's a great location with a lot of things to do in the area. There were numerous places to eat in the immediate area. The rooms were very clean and the WIFI was nice to have. I have to say that the best asset to this location was the staff. They were very nice and courteous. We checked in later in the evening and Dave made sure we knew what restaurants were in the area. The night we got back home we realized we left our 4 year olds favorite stuffed animal in the room. I talked to Lisa the next morning and explained the situation and she called me back an hour later stating that they found his toy and was in the process of shipping it to my house. Two days later it arrived safely in the mail. Now that is awesome service, thanks HOJO San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Canadian in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: 752manitoba
Reviews.Content: Great place to start in San Diego if you this is your first time. Close to airport. They have an airport shuttle that when we called was at airport in 20 m. Older motel style but updated and very clean. Price was very good (Expedia). Staff very friendly and helpful. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: dysartdc
Reviews.Content: Great location for getting around San Diego. Room was large with comfortable beds. Bathroom was newly remodeled. Continental breakfas was good. Staff was very helpful getting us where we needed to go. Convenient to Old Town and the Embarcadero. Easy trip to Sea World and the Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: lizpinky
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the day and it was no problem leaving our bags so we could explore for the day. The first thing is that it really isn't near Seaworld. It's a $20 ccab fare away, so that was a bit misleading. The hotel itself was very nicely presented and clean so we thougth that was a good start. When we arrived back at the hotel that first evening we were given a room with only one bed and we had requested 2 beds, luckily we had our booking confirmation with us because the evening clerk wanted to charge us an extra $20 a night. We sorted that out and then we found we had no hot water. We reported this and were made to feel like idiots. Same thing next morning, no hot water and we were assured thaey would look into it. Again that evening no hot water. Reported to the same clerk again, he called the houseboy to invrstigate because they don't have a weekend maintenance man. We were told that because the occupancy rate was low the hot water took at least five minutes to reach our side of the hotel, but unfortunately still no hot water then or the next morning. Finanlly when we arrived home on our 3rd night a new clerk had the commonsense to move us to the side of the hotel that did have a least warm water. The weekend male clerk couldn't even greet us much less apologise for lack of water, which would have not been a hard thing to do as sorry is sometimes all you need to hear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FAMVACLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and I was pleasantly surprised with how nice the rooms were. It is very clean, roomy, and quiet. The modern decor was a nice change from the usual drab rooms in other hotels. The free breakfast was nice, not great, but better than most. The staff was very polite and quick with all check-in and check-out procedures. It was also close to fast food chains and other stores. It was probably less than ten minutes away from Sea World. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Marine Graduation”
Reviews.Author: sdettmers
Reviews.Content: I want to thank everyone at Howard Johnson Sea World/San Diego Airport starting with the manager Jessica Rubalcava, office workers, maintenance, housekeeping, and anyone else I have forgotten to mention. They went the extra mile to accommodate our every request. We needed an extra computer to use, scheduled shuttle rides to and from the MCRD and they even got our taxi's ready for us to go back to the airport. I have traveled extensively and rate my three day experience a perfect 10. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Daleyocean
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property and we were very very pleased, the property is older but the rooms are comfortable and very clean, great water pressure and the HVAC system works great! The staff was exceptionally friendly and informative, not once during our stay did we hear "I do not know"..if they did not have the information readily available, they looked it up and got back to us. The hotel is within easy walking distance of "Old Town" (Maybe a mile so if you have walking issues it is an easy drive) and the trolley (Light Rail) station. Old Town is fun with lots of great dining, and from the transit center you can take advantage of the citys excellent public transit system, we had a concert to go to at SDSU and it could not have been easier, (Take advantage of the MTS web site and use the "Trip Planner") and we took the "Blue Line" to downtown SD and enjoyed the GasLamp area, and hopped a bus to Balboa Park and the SD Zoo. A short distance from the hotel on Sports Area Drive I believe?? Catch the #8 in front of Chuck E Cheeses to hit Mission & Pacific Beaches, there is an amusement park at Mission Beach and they have one of the original wooden roller coasters. There is a lot of shopping and dining in the immediate area and we live in a very small remote town so we were pleased just to partake in the In N Out!! There is shuttle service available to/from the airport & Seaworld and they were timely and very friendly, I cannot get over this staff however, they were great the that is a backbone of a good hotel!! This was one of our best vacations in rencent memory and I highly recommend San Diego and the Howard Johnsond, San Diego Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Average but lacking”
Reviews.Author: timbuktudad
Reviews.Content: One of my most important needs at a motel is highspeed internet. That was the first things I checked and Howard Johnson Seaworld stated they have it in every room. When I complained about it twice, they did not seem to care and gave me a Tec Service number to call for help. The internet service sucked and was for the most part non-existent. The shuttle bus to and from MCRD only runs for approx. an hour and you need 24 hour notice. The cleaning lady did not show up till after 4:00 pm every day, just about the time we got back every day. Oh ya, on the morning we checked out, the front desk worker asked me how we were getting to the airport. I told him I already had a cab coming and he got pissed and stated that they are suppose to call the cab for us and demanded to know what cab I had called. I refused as it was none of his busness. He was angry at me for this. From what I could tell, I think this guy had a friend who owns or drives for a cab and he was mad because he lost a job for his buddy. I called and made my cab reservation the night before to ensure that they would be on time.

Reviews.Title: “from Michigan for mcrd graduation Sept 18”
Reviews.Author: mi41
Reviews.Content: We liked the fact hotel had shuttle to mcrd.Front desk staff very helpful,breakfast in the morning was a welcome addition being as though mornings were on a tight schedule.Any extras such as towels and roll away bed were asked for and brought promptly. Internet in lobby was a bonus to print out boarding passes. Hotel was clean and room was cleaned on regular bases although air was turned off by the cleaning staff while we were at the marine base and we came back after being in the heat all day to a very hot room.Other than that stay was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “New Marine & family enjoyed the great feeling of "you're family"”
Reviews.Author: TexanTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend after my son's graduation from MCRD. The staff was very helpful. Room was large - which we greatly appreciated with all the bags our new Marine had. We appreciated the computer in the lobby with Internet access so that we could get our boarding passes the day before our flight. The fact that the hotel was near MCRD & Airport made it so easy to get around. Only complaint was that the breakfast area was too small and they had a hard time keeping items stocked because of all the families that stay there. Best time for breakfast was when it opened at 6am. Anytime after that you were at least two people deep to get to anything. Thank you Howard Johnson for a wonderful San Diego experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful to Marine Families”
Reviews.Author: greatdayMadison_wi
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego not knowing what to expect. We came here for Marine Graduation and we had a whole week to explore this beautiful city. The staff here was AMAZING!!!!! They answered all of our questions and gave us good ideas as to where we should go. The service here is great and the rooms are very clean. I highly recommend this hotel and I definetly will be coming back soon.

Reviews.Title: “HoJo - Sea World , Excellent Value for Money.”
Reviews.Author: LA_KASH
Reviews.Content: Price : It was 10 $ higher than the cheapest (but decent) hotel available in San Diego. Proximity to tourist attractions: Excellent. This location is close to most of the attractions within San Diego City specially Sea World, Zoo and Beaches. Check In Experience: OK. Front Desk was courteous and to the point. I had to wait at the reception for a few minutes because the room was not ready. But that's all. Room: Room was very nice. Interior was pleasing and simplistic, All amenities inside the room were in good conditions and clean. TV picture quality was clear which typically is so-so most of the time in other hotels. Parking: I did not have any issues with parking but this could be an issue at times in my opinion. Parking space seems to be just sufficient. Amenities: They have a small swimming pool. I saw lots of kids playing around in it. Breakfast area is small probably sitting capacity is 25 guests. On a busy Sunday it can be crowded so be prepared. Surrounding Area: Walgreenâ€™s and CVS are at walking distance and so are Chipotle and couple of other fast food joints. I did find many homeless around the area but did not feel any negative vibes. They did not bother me and I did not bother them :) Check Out: Check out was super fast. Took me less than two minutes. Over all Experience: A Very pleasant stay. For a few bucks less than what I had to pay, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Marine Family stayed May '04 & will be staying again Nov '09”
Reviews.Author: MarineMomx2PL
Reviews.Content: Our extended family stayed for 5 nights back in May 2004 and booked 4 rooms. We will be doing the same in Nov 2009 for our 2nd future Marine Son. Our stay in 2004 was excellent and we felt the HoJo went above and beyond to accomadate its guests! This time we are planning on staying 6 nights so that we can do more of the tourisim thing. We are from Iowa and felt perfectly safe while staying there. We are really looking forward to our return trip and are hoping the weather will be decent the week before Thanksgiving! We learned about your HoJo in 2004 from Max Berup from the MarineParents website.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Thunderfist
Reviews.Content: I'm a little off on this one, but I thought this place deserved a decent review. We book our trip about a year ago because the wife wanted to go to Sea World. We were originally going to stay down in Mission Beach..but the prices were a little steep. So we stayed here at the Howard Johnson. Location: With a rental car, it's just a few miles from Sea World--and literally just down the road from Old Town. It's a ways from Downtown proper, but we were more interested in Sea World and Mission beach than anything. I've heard some people say this was in a 'seedy' part of town. I'll just say it's not located in Beverly Hills...but in retrospect I would probably buy a house within a 4 or 5 block radius and let the kids play in the front yard. Get the idea? It's in a busy area for sure and there are a few close by liquor stores--which no matter where you are--always bring out a few hooligans, but nothing to worry about. We actually met our neighbors next to us, and we all had drinks to celebrate their departure on their upcoming cruise. Good times! Value: Hands down--a great value. We paid alot less than we thought. The rooms were nice and clean and the beds were very comfortable. Along with the free breakfast, we couldn't go wrong. Would I stay here again? Absolutely. Like I said, It ain't the Hyatt Regency--it's a budget motel. And if you are looking for a decent place to rest your head at night--relatively close to Sea World then you got a deal here. They have a standard continental breakfast bar where you can make your own waffles--always a bonus to get a free meal for the day. P.S. Before you complain to the front desk about the ICE machine not working, just be aware you have to put your keycard in the machine in order for it to work! I felt like an idiot afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: TechGuy1970
Reviews.Content: My family spent two nights at the Ho-Jo in San Diego. I picked it for the cost and proximity to Sea World and the Harbor. It is in an interesting location. Close to lots of shopping and restaurants, but also just blocks away from several adult clubs. The rooms were kind of dark and smelled a little smoky/musty even though our room was non-smoking, but the bathroom was pretty big and the beds were pretty comfortable. The air conditioner was pretty noisy. This may be a Ho-Jo thing because the one by Disneyland in Anaheim is the same way. Also, the walls are very thin. We could hear our neighbors pretty clearly, and they didn't seem to be acting too rambunctious. There was a Jamba Juice, Starbucks and Bagel place across the street that was great for breakfast, but parking is tight. If you are on a budget, need this location, and aren't going to spend a lot of time in your room, the Ho-Jo may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Walls thin, too many homeless in neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: srmurrayut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 5/26-29 2009. The room (248) was clean and the facility seemed well maintained, but the wall insulation is pretty thin. We would keep our TV low enough that we could barely hear it but the people in the room next door kept compaining that they could hear our TV over their Air Conditioning. The neighboorhood has a lot of apts and retail stores, restaurants, etc. but there are many homeless with their possessions in shopping carts panhandling, etc. We definately did not want to walk to any shops after dark. A convienent location for most everything in SD, only about a mile from Old Town. Stayed here because of low price but will look at another area next time. Staff was quite good for us, offered to move us to another room if neighbors became too troublesome. Breakfast did not offer much variety as we are used to.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Carpets and Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: fuman2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worst places I have seen. The first room we were given had stained and dirty carpets. The chairs were also stained and dirty. We asked for and got a second room which was better but still had dirty and stained carpets. Our kids could not walk in bare feet because of the carpet. The pool is not heated and in March was not warm enough to swim in. Dirty comforters were left on our floor after cleaning. There was also homeless people sleeping in the doorway of the building next to us. The location was convenient to Sea World but there is a bunch of sex shops right down the street. It was not fun having to explain to our young children about these places.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Asians!!”
Reviews.Author: asianeffex
Reviews.Content: My best friend just graduated from the Marines and we stayed at this one from Wednesay to saturday. I thought I was in Asian Heaven! The bed was more comfortable that my one at home and there is lots of great Thai food in the neighborhood of it. The staff was increadible, the night person (randy?) was really nice because I made him come open our room and change key and stuff like ten times and he always said 'no trouble at all' hehe. if I ever go to California again I will stay at this one just because of that! The breakfast waffles were good too but I only had it once. Very close to trollys and lots of stuff to see. I will remember my trip to here forever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lewzealand
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Howard Johnson Inn San Diego was great. The room was clean and quiet, and the bed was comfortable. Not much more to say about the room, really. And our interaction with the staff was limited to check-in and check-out, and at that, both staffers we dealt with were friendly. We only stayed the night, but were definitely satisfied with our stay. Conveniently located near the highway, the hotel is near plenty of food establisments, including a mexican restaurant that offers deals to hotel guests, a bagel joint across the street, as well as a Chipotle and In-N-Out Burger within walking distance. Sea World and downtown San Diego are also nearby. If you're just looking for a nice place to hang your hat for the night, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed with the HoJo SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: moni0121
Reviews.Content: A couple of family members and I were in town for my brother's graduation from MCRD San Diego, and stayed a few days after to take in some sights, etc. This was quite possibly the nicest chain-type hotel that I've stayed in before. It was very clean, and the staff was not only friendly, but helped out as much as they possibly could. It was late when we checked-in, but the night clerk, Randy, made sure that we got on the list for the shuttle to MCRD for Family & Graduation Day. The area the hotel is located in is decent, and surprisingly quiet. There are all kinds of fast food, clothing stores, etc. within walking distance. Mission Beach, Ocean Beach & Belmont Park are approx. 10 min. drive, too. There's a computer for guest use in the lobby with a 15 min. time limit, if someone else is waiting to use it. They offer a self-serve breakfast with some of the items offered being muffins, breads for toast, dry cereal, milk, coffee, orange juice, DIY waffles, and fruit. I will definitely stay here again, if in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: ArkyViv
Reviews.Content: My family and I reserved our rooms because of the close proximity to MCRD. After reading some of the reviews we were a little skeptical and were worried about our choice, but, because of the shuttle service we took our chances. I was very very pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness and overall comfortablenes of our room. The beds were pillow top mattresses and very comfortable. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful to us. They took the time to help us figure out the bus systems and answered all our questions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area and especially to those there for the Marine graduation ceremonies.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: aussie1Sydney
Reviews.Content: As a family of four we could not have chosen a better place to stay in San Diego. It is close to all the major attractions ( e.g. Sea World, Zoo, Legoland etc) and is perfectly located across the roads from shops that include chemists, supermarkets and food centres. The rooms are very good. Comfortable beds, coffee-maker, safe and a shower that works well. Noise was not a problem on the second floor. The free breakfast was great - toast, juice, muffins, coffee and even a waffle-maker for those who are into them! ( As an Aussie I am not sure about it for breakfast!!!!!) Found all staff to be extremely helpful - in particular Shane was full of useful information at the desk. They have a deal with Sizzler across the road where you receive a 15% discount. The kids loved the food so we went there four nights in a row!! (Yes, I know we need to get a life!!!) The hotel also has a mexican restaurant that looked lovely, but I didn't get a chance to check it out. They did have the two best waitresses in the world - Paola and Fantasia. (If you go there please say hi for me!) The hotel also provided access to a computer which had internet access in the foyer which was great to check up on e-mails or find directions. The free shuttle service to someof the attractions was also great. Ontime and right where they said they would be. I would have no hesitation in staying there again when visiting San Diego.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Inn - San Diego Sea World / Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 3330 Rosecrans St, San Diego, CA 92110
